Sentencas: Redox-stable solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes are developed in order to improve durability at higher fuel utilization, as a possible alternative to conventional Ni-zirconia cermet anodes.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: Ce0.9Gd0.1O2 (GDC) is utilized as a mixed ionic and electronic conductor (MIEC), in combination with Sr0.9La0.1TiO3 (LST) as an electronic conductor.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: The stability of noble metals (Rh, Pt, and Pd) is analyzed via thermochemical calculation of stable phases.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: Noble metal catalyst nanoparticles are incorporated via co-impregnation with GDC.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: The electrochemical characteristics of SOFC single cells using these anode materials are investigated in highly-humidified H-2 at 800 degrees C. Their stability at high fuel utilization is analyzed.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: These co-impregnated anodes with highly dispersed noble metal catalysts on the LST-GDC conducting backbones, achieve high I-V performance comparable to conventional Ni-cermet anodes.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: The co-impregnated anodes also achieve considerably high catalytic mass activity.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: At higher oxygen partial pressure, where the Ni catalyst can be deactivated by oxidation, these noble catalysts are thermochemically stable in the metallic state, and tolerant against oxidation.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: This class of alternative catalyst, impregnated with low-loading of noble metals could contribute to stable operation in the downstream region of SOFC systems.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization

Sentencas: A simple cost analysis indicates a tolerance of using noble metals, provided their loading is sufficiently low.
Titulo: SOFC anodes impregnated with noble metal catalyst nanoparticles for high fuel utilization
